title: South Africa determined not to make same mistake twice as they admit to fearing Japan's high-tempo game
text:
If South Africa’s plan is to ultimately strangle Japan of possession in their World Cup quarter-final on Sunday, first they are attempting to suffocate the hosts with kindness in the build-up to David vs Goliath: the rematch.

This time, however, Goliath is nervously eyeing the slingshot that gave him a black eye in 2015 and has since bloodied the noses of both Ireland and Scotland. The charm offensive began by head coach Rassie Erasmus on Monday has continued as Springbok after Springbok lined up to praise Japan for their performances on the pitch and their hospitality off it.
